title: Meeting calls for early completion of model prison project at H-16
content:
ISLAMABAD, Jan 2 (APP):Member Prime Minister Implementation Commission (PMIC) Engr. Aamir Hasan on Tuesday showing dissatisfaction over the implementation status of the Public Sector Development Programme (PSDP) project “Construction of Model Prison at H-16, Islamabad” directed to complete the project in true letter and spirit.
He directed for speedy and effective completion of the project with deadlines which had been significantly delayed.
He was chairing a meeting to review the status of the project. The meeting was attended by Muhammad Saleh Narejo, Director, PMIC and the officers of Ministry of Interior, Ministry of Planning, Development & Special Initiatives, Ministry of Housing & Works, Pakistan Public Works Department (Pak PWD), National Highway Authority (NHA), Islamabad Capital Territory (ICT), Capital Development Authority (CDA), Rawalpindi Development Authority (RDA) in person and Punjab Prison Department through online.
During the meeting the Member PMIC said the implementation report regarding progress in the project will be submitted to the Prime Minister of Pakistan.
Earlier Chairman PMIC Brig. (Retd) Muzaffar Ali Ranjha, took cognizance of the concerns of the Prime Minister of Pakistan over the unwarranted delays in the completion of Public Sector Development Programme (PSDP) projects.
After showing dissatisfaction over the implementation status and also latest progress on decisions were made in the meeting held on December 20, 2023 at PMIC from Ministry of Interior and Pak PWD regarding the delays in completion of the project, the monitoring task was given to Engr. Aamir Hasan, Member PMIC (former retired Federal Secretary) for ensuring effective supervision of the project.
The representatives of Ministry of Interior, Ministry of Planning, Development and Special Initiatives, Ministry of Housing and Works, Pak PWD, NHA, ICT, CDA, RDA and Punjab Prison Department briefed the Member, PMIC on the implementation status and latest progress on decisions were made in the meeting held on December 12, 2023 on the Model Prison Project.
